question: Which of the following is not a benefit of Native studies programs in educational institutions?

answers.text: Native studies programs allow Indigenous people to be actively involved in the writing of their own histories.
Native studies programs allow Native scholars to describe their cultures and philosophies from Indigenous perspectives.
Native studies programs depend on textbooks as the main reliable source of information.
Native studies programs allow Native scholars to establish positions of influence over the presentation and study of Indigenous history and culture.
